1.greeting: *Yawn* Hmm... Wonder if things will be okay when we get back...

prompt.4: Well... We're almost home at least.

sentence.1: Morning. Did you end up readjusting the settings for the ship's course?
sentence.3: Sometimes, it feels like they didn't fund this project enough.
sentence.4: Yeah. Hopefully things will be okay once we get home.

2.greeting: *Sigh* Where's my coffee when I need it...

prompt.1: Do you know what happened earlier?

sentence.1: I didn't really go by the engine room if that's what you're asking.
sentence.2: I found it weird to hear that the settings had been changed too.
sentence.3: Sometimes I wonder if we were being set up.
sentence.4: Mmm... Nevermind. It's probably just this old man's paranoia.

3.greeting: (Johnny seems to be silently enjoying his fresh coffee today)

sentence.1: Yeah, he finally got off of his butt and helped out.
sentence.2: You've been fixing a majority of the issues nowadays.
sentence.3: He's definitely had more free time to mess around lately.
sentence.4: Maybe you should... He almost broke my coffee machine, you know.
sentence.5: Just keep him out of my things...
sentence.6: It seems like more problems have been occuring lately.
sentence.7: I don't know if it's all just coincidence anymore.

4.greeting: Seems like there are so many problems lately...

sentence.1: Hm...? I haven't been by communications, so I couldn't really say.
sentence.2: Maybe that feeling of paranoia was right...
sentence.3: I can't say whether we've been set up but there have been too many issues lately.
sentence.4: All of us have something in common, kid.

5.greeting: Damn it, the stupid power out made my coffee machine break...

prompt.1: Did you see anyone by the power room?
prompt.2: ... I don't have any proof... but...

sentence.1: Nope. You think someone's causing problems on purpose?
sentence.2: I see... You have a good head on your shoulders... I would be cautious too.
sentence.3: I can't say I would even trust myself... but the others may take it badly.
sentence.4: We've been together on this mission all these years after all.

6.greeting: Mmm... I really feel like we can't trust them...

sentence.1: *Johnny spits out his coffee* Fuck! You scared me! I meant the ones who highered us.
sentence.2: I told you didn't I? There's something we all have in common.
sentence.3: Well... Either way, even if I don't trust them, we're here anyways.
sentence.4: I can't do much about it now. So I just have to wait and see.
sentence.5: Just be careful kid. I could care less about myself, but you all are still young.

prompt.1: Hey, did you want some coffee?

sentence.1: Awww shit, thanks. I definitely needed this.
sentence.2: I'm never awake enough for anything I swear. *chugs the entire thing in a second*
If you don't want your daily coffee just send it my way.

sentence.1: I'm probably going to just go back to living normally, the way I used to.
sentence.2: I doubt they'd call me in again after this... I'm getting too old.
sentence.3: Someone else would end up taking my place on the next mission though.
sentence.4: They always bring a crew member who has taken on the mission there before.

sentence.1: I love coffee and alcohol. You'd probably find me in a cafe or bar.
sentence.2: Really, I was only doing this for the money to live easy with my family.
